meta.title: All That I Can Do Is Sing The Blues

lyrics: You’ve got me where you want me You’ve got me on the floor
I’ve had my share of troubles
But I ain’t been down here before You used to say you loved me
But now I don’t believe that that was true You’ve got me where you want me
And all that I can do is sing the blues
You’ve been spending all my money Now I haven’t got a dime
I didn’t care one penny
When I thought that you were mine Now that I’ve seen through you
I don’t believe that that was ever true (I’m telling you)
Now I’m sad and broke and lonely And all that I can do is sing the blues
Why did you start throwing those sticks and stones
Giving me the third degree?
I know that there’s no going back
But you still matter to me
I lent you my car
You didn’t bring it back
Now I’m mourning for my 1956 Cadillac
I’ve been walking so long
I’ve got holes in both soles of my shoes
(It’s true)
Now I’m a long way from home
And all that I can do is sing the blues
